page.title: 07LOCAL FOLKLORE
page.content: To the east of the holiday camp is a cleft in the cliff at G.R. 537 885 known locally as 'Crazy Mary's Hole'. Mary was a love-sick girl who gave her heart to a sailor. He never returned from sea and she spent her short life pining on the sea shore. Eventually she died and her body was found on the beach. The story is told in {'Folktales and Legends of Suffolk'} by G. M. Dixon, (Minimax Books). On nearby Bloodmoor Hill at G.R. 520 895 it is said that a fierce {battle} was fought between the Romano-British settlers and the invading Saxons. Implements, coins and a few remains of horse harness from the period have been discovered at the site. This is recorded in 'Flinten History' by Rev. Canon Stather-Hunt.
